lead_paragraph: Though Mr. Comey acted publicly, while J. Edgar Hoover maneuvered in secret, Hoover was the last F.B.I. director to be accused of trying to influence a presidential election.

byline.original: By SCOTT SHANE and SHARON LaFRANIERE

headline.print_headline: Comey Role Recalls Hoover’s F.B.I., Fairly or Not
headline.main: James Comey Role Recalls Hoover’s F.B.I., Fairly or Not

snippet: Though Mr. Comey acted publicly, while J. Edgar Hoover maneuvered in secret, Hoover was the last F.B.I. director to be accused of trying to influence a presidential election....
abstract: Some critics and historians draw parallels between FBI director James B Comey, who violated Justice Dept policy by releasing information about investigation of Hillary Clinton's email server, and late controversial agency director J Edgar Hoover; Comey's defenders say comparison is absurd, dismissing notion that Comey acted to tip scales in 2016 presidential election.
